message.content: This question requires some basic reasoning skills. If something is blown apart and it was living prior to that, it means that it was subjected to some kind of destructive force. In this case, it fell in harm's way because it was destroyed. Option (A) is incorrect because we cannot assume that it only experienced good things before being blown apart. Option (B) is also incorrect because if it was blown apart, it was not perfectly safe. Option (D) is incorrect because being blown apart is not a natural way for something to die.

This question requires inference and logic based on the information given. If a thing is blown apart and was living prior to that happening, it implies that the thing was harmed or put in harm's way. Option (A) cannot be inferred from the information given. Option (B) also cannot be inferred as there is no information given about the safety of the thing prior to being blown apart. Option (D) is incorrect because being blown apart is not a natural way for something to die. Therefore, option (C) is the most logical answer.

Option (B) is incorrect because if the living thing was always perfectly safe, it would not have been blown apart. Option (D) is incorrect because being blown apart is not a natural or normal way for a living thing to die.
